title: How Many Calories Are in a Glass of Red Wine?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a glass of red wine—about 125 kcal per standard 150 ml serving—plus carbs, alcohol content, and variations for different types.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Glass of Red Wine?
assumptions: Standard 5 oz (150 ml) serving of dry red wine, 13% ABV, no added sugar.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, brand, alcohol content, sweetness, and serving size. Check labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard glass of red wine contains about 125 calories, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a glass of red wine?
faqs.a: Approximately 125 kcal for a standard 150 ml serving of dry red wine.
Yes, about 3.8 g carbs per glass, mainly from residual sugars and alcohol fermentation.

faqs.q: How does wine alcohol content affect calories?
faqs.a: Higher ABV increases calories; 13% ABV is standard, but 15% adds ~15-20 kcal per glass.

faqs.q: Are there calories in dealcoholized red wine?
faqs.a: Much lower—around 20-30 kcal per glass, from carbs only, without alcohol's contribution.

faqs.q: What serving size is a standard glass of red wine?
faqs.a: Typically 5 oz (150 ml), but pours vary; always measure for accuracy.
